com.socrata.api

Class Soda2Producer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.socrata.api.Soda2Base
      • com.socrata.api.Soda2Consumer
        • com.socrata.api.Soda2Producer

  • public class Soda2Producer
extends Soda2Consumer
    API for sending requests to the SODA server for adding/removing/modifying objects in the datasets. This class does NOT deal with modifying dataset schema.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.socrata.api.Soda2Consumer

    • Method Detail

      • newProducer

        public static final Soda2Producer newProducer(String url,
                        String userName,
                        String password,
                        String token)
        Create a new Soda2Producer object, using the supplied credentials for authentication.
        Parameters:
        url - the base URL for the SODA2 domain to access.
        userName - user name to log in as
        password - password to log in with
        token - the App Token to use for authorization and usage tracking. If this is null, no value will be sent.
        Returns:
        fully configured Soda2Producer

      • truncate

        public void truncate(String resourceId)
              throws SodaError,
                     InterruptedException
        Truncates a dataset by deleting all rows in the dataset.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - id of the dataset to truncate
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

      • delete

        public void delete(String resourceId,
          String id)
            throws SodaError,
                   InterruptedException
        Deletes a row from a dataset.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - resourceId id of the dataset to delete a record from
        id - id of the record to delete. This should be the unique id of the record, which could be either the id the system sets, or the Row Identifier.
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

      • addObject

                 T object)
               throws SodaError,
                      InterruptedException
        Add an object using SODA2, the object will be added to the dataset with the specified resource ID.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        object - object to add
        Returns:
        the metadata of the row added, including the system identifier
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

              T object,
              Class<T> retType)
            throws SodaError,
                   InterruptedException
        Add an object using SODA2, the object will be added to the dataset with the specified resource ID.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        object - object to add
        retType - the type of object to return
        Returns:
        the metadata of the row added, including the system identifier
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

      • upsert

        public UpsertResult upsert(String resourceId,
                  List objects)
                    throws SodaError,
                           InterruptedException
        "Upserts" a list of objects. What this means is that it will:
        1. Add the objects in the list.
        2. If an object already exists with this value, it will update it.
        3. If the object has a :deleted=true value, the object will be deleted.

        In order to delete objects using the Upsert function, use the DeleteRecord object to map ":deleted" to an :id.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        objects - list of objects to upsert
        Returns:
        result of objects added, removed and modified.
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

      • replace

        public UpsertResult replace(String resourceId,
                   List objects)
                     throws SodaError,
                            InterruptedException
        Replaces a dataset with a list of objects. This is the same as doing a truncate, followed by an upsert, except that it will happen atomically (so you cannot have a failure that puts the dataset in a half state)
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        objects - list of objects to replace the contents of the dataset with
        Returns:
        Upsert result describing number of objects added/removed as well as errors.
        Throws:
        SodaError
        InterruptedException

      • upsertStream

        public UpsertResult upsertStream(String resourceId,
                        javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType mediaType,
                        InputStream stream)
                          throws SodaError,
                                 InterruptedException
        "Upserts" a list of objects. What this means is that it will:
        1. Add the objects in the list.
        2. If an object already exists with this value, it will update it.
        3. If the object has a :deleted=true value, the object will be deleted.

        In order to delete objects using the Upsert function, use the DeleteRecord object to map ":deleted" to an :id.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        mediaType - what the format of the stream is. Normally, HttpLowLevel.JSON_TYPE or HttpLowLevel.CSV_TYPE
        stream - JSON stream of objects to update
        Returns:
        result of objects added, removed and modified.
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

      • replaceStream

        public UpsertResult replaceStream(String resourceId,
                         javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType mediaType,
                         InputStream stream)
                           throws SodaError,
                                  InterruptedException
        Replaces a dataset with a the objects serialized in an input stream. This is the same as doing a truncate, followed by an upsert, except that it will happen atomically (so you cannot have a failure that puts the dataset in a half state)
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        mediaType - what the format of the stream is. Normally, HttpLowLevel.JSON_TYPE or HttpLowLevel.CSV_TYPE
        stream - JSON stream of objects to replace the existing dataset with.
        Returns:
        Upsert result describing number of objects added/removed as well as errors.
        Throws:
        SodaError
        InterruptedException

      • upsertCsv

        public UpsertResult upsertCsv(String resourceId,
                     File csvFile)
                       throws SodaError,
                              InterruptedException
        "Upserts" a list of objects. What this means is that it will:
        1. Add the objects in the list.
        2. If an object already exists with this value, it will update it.
        3. If the object has a :deleted=true value, the object will be deleted.

        In order to delete objects using the Upsert function, use the DeleteRecord object to map ":deleted" to an :id.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        csvFile - File that contains a CSV to upload
        Returns:
        result of objects added, removed and modified.
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.

      • replaceCsv

        public UpsertResult replaceCsv(String resourceId,
                      File csvFile)
                        throws SodaError,
                               InterruptedException
        Replaces a dataset with the rows defined in the provided CSV. This is logically the same thing as doing a truncate followed by an upsertCsv, with the advantage of being atomic (so failures can't cause a half-state)
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        csvFile - File that contains a CSV to replace the dataset with
        Returns:
        Upsert result describing number of objects added/removed as well as errors.
        Throws:
        SodaError
        InterruptedException

      • update

        public <T> Meta update(String resourceId,
              Object id,
              T object)
            throws SodaError,
                   InterruptedException
        Updates an object in a dataset.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - unique id or resource name of the dataset
        id - Id based on a dataset specific unique column, or the system ID created for each row.
        object - object to update the result with
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SodaError - thrown if there is an error. Investigate the structure for more information.
        InterruptedException - throws is the thread is interrupted.
